item.title: Severe overhanging tree causing damage, 6th September
item.description:
I am writing to formally request urgent action regarding a tree located at the rear of our property. The branches of this tree are substantially overhanging our boundary and are now directly causing damage to our garden office and fence. The overhanging branches are in continuous contact with the roof of our garden office, leading to deterioration and the risk of further structural harm, particularly during adverse weather. In addition, the branches are exerting pressure against our boundary fence, which has already begun to weaken as a result. Given the extent of the encroachment and the physical damage already being sustained, we must request that the council arrange for this tree to be pruned back without delay. Allowing the tree to remain in its current state will only lead to further damage, increased repair costs, and potentially pose a safety risk. We therefore ask that the council address this matter as a priority and confirm what steps will be taken to resolve it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stoke Newington High Street - rubbish constantly piled up, 6th September
item.description:
Rubbish constantly piled up along the whole of Stoke Newington High Street outside of collection times. How is this allowed to happen? It's unsightly, makes the area look ugly and it's a trip hazard. Please do something.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches, 6th September
item.description:
Hi. There are a number of trees down this street that need attention. I have lived down this street nearly 20yrs and never seen any of the trees cut back. The tree outside my address 61 rosebery avenue has interfered with our reception for many years and we have had the dish moved 3 times and it can’t be moved higher anymore. Trees need to be maintained and they are not. There is also a notice from the council which has been in place on another tree down this road stating there will be some action . This was placed months ago. It stated that action would take place at the beginning of August and it’s now the beginning of September. So many trees need attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Rosebery Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ineffective signage, 6th September
item.description:
The signs indicating a no right turn into Village Way from Crossways Road, are still proving ineffective. Vehicles are regularly still nit seeing or ignoring the existing signs on the traffic lights. Would it maybe possible to add larger metallic signage?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Crossways Road, Eden Park, London

item.title: Bins blocking pavement, 6th September
item.description:
Reported multiple times over several months to Lambeth. Pavement continue to be inaccessible outside 37 and 35 Chantrey rd. it’s an issue along entire road where bins block the pavements. Pedestrians forced to walk on road especially those with push chairs or wheelchairs

item.title: Massive spider graffiti facing Durand Wharf, 6th September
item.description:
On the back of the Jubilee line tunnel exit, Durand Wharf. Massive spider graffiti on an otherwise blank wall. It’s not facing the street, it’s facing the Wharf which is used as a recreational space by lots of people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle for over a year, 6th September
item.description:
Bexley council negligence in identifying abandoned vehicle with MOT that expired 21 April 2025 and Tax that expired 01 May 2025. I once had a untaxed car that I moved from my drive for just 1 hour for a van to park, and Bexley fined me so it is ridiculous that 4 months have passed and no action has been taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pelham Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
